page.title: 04TRANSPORT: Main Road/Buses
page.content: The major road running through our area is the{A642}between{Huddersfield} and{Wakefield.} It divides at Waterloo, the other fork becoming the {A629}to{Sheffield.} Thus, much of the traffic flows between these three busy centres. Also, the roads link the M62 and Ml motorways. Where the two roads diverge is the Yorkshire Traction bus depot at Waterloo. {Yorkshire Traction Bus Depot} The station holds l8 double decker and lO single decker buses. Twenty-three buses are out daily, the others being serviced. There are 82 drivers but no conductors, l2 mechanics, 5 inspectors and 4 office staff. The staff work shifts of 8 hours l8 minutes or about 43 hours weekly, and there is a canteen at the depot. There are machines which steam clean, or wash, the buses.
